alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Geneva (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 8:54PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Coffee and northwestern Geneva Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 853 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles north of Laurel Hill to near Andalusia to 6 miles southeast of Opp. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Samson, Kinston, Earlytown, Hacoda, Spears, Pera, Alberton, Perry Store, Weeks, Sellersville, Lucile, Rhoades, Ino, Logan Field Municipal A/P, Ganer, Holley Store, Lowery, Marvin Chapel and Central City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
